isopy.calc¶

isopy.calc.isotope_to_ratio(data, denominator)[source]¶

Converts an IsotopeArray into a RatioArray with a specified denominator.

Parameters:
  • data (IsotopeArray) – Data that is to be converted to an RatioArray
  • denominator (IsotopeString) – Denominator to be used in ratios. Must be present in data.
Returns:
Return type:

RatioArray
isopy.calc.ratio_to_isotope(data, denominator_value=1)[source]¶

Converts a ratio data array into isotope data array.

Parameters:
  • data (RatioArray) – Ratio data to be converted. All ratios must share the same denominator
  • denominator_value (float) – Set denominator to this value and multiply all other values by it. Default = 1
Returns:
Return type:

IsotopeArray
isopy.calc.normalise_ratio_to_reference(data, reference_abu, factor=1, subtract_one=True)[source]¶
isopy.calc.denomralise_ratio_from_reference(data, reference_abu, factor=1, add_one=True)[source]¶
isopy.calc.internal_normalisation(data, ratio, std_abu, std_mass, law='exponential')[source]¶

Correct data for mass fractionation using a fixed ratio and specified law.

Parameters:
  • data (numpy.ndarray) – Data array containing values to be correctd
  • ratio (RatioString) – Ratio that will be fixed. Must be present in data
  • std_abu (dict) – A dict containing the reference composition of the normalisation ratio.
  • std_mass (dict) – A dict containing all the mass of all ratios in data.
  • law (str) – The mass fractionation law to be used. Only exponential fractionation is supported. Default = ‘exponential’
Returns:

Normalised data array.
Return type:

numpy.ndarray
isopy.calc.correct_mass_fractionation(data, mf_factor, std_mass, law='exponential')[source]¶

Correct data using specified mass fractionation factor.

Parameters:
  • data (RatioArray) – Data array containing values to be corrected
  • mf_factor (float) – Mass fractionation factor to be applied to data
  • std_mass (IsoRatDict) – A dict containing all the mass of all ratios in data.
  • law (str) – The mass fractionation law to be used. Only exponential fractionation is supported. Default = ‘exponential’
Returns:

Normalised data array.
Return type:

RatioArray
isopy.calc.calculate_mass_fractionation_factor(data, ratio, std_abu, std_mass, law='exponential')[source]¶

Calculate the mass fractionation factor for a specified ratio.

Parameters:
  • data (RatioArray) – Data array containing values to be corrected
  • ratio (RatioString) – Ratio that will be fixed. Must be present in data
  • std_abu (IsoRatDict) – A dict containing the reference composition of the normalisation ratio.
  • std_mass (IsoRatDict) – A dict containing all the mass of all ratios in data.
  • law (str) – The mass fractionation law to be used. Only exponential fractionation is supported. Default = ‘exponential’
Returns:

Normalised data array.
Return type:

RatioArray
isopy.calc.calculate_exponential_mass_fractionation_factor(measured_abu, std_abu, std_mass)[source]¶

Return the exponential mass fractionation factor.

Parameters:
  • measured_abu (float) – The measured abundance ratio between two isotopes
  • std_abu (float) – The reference abundance ratio between two isotopes
  • std_mass (float) – The mass ratio between two isotopes
Returns:

The exponential mass fractionation factor
Return type:

float
isopy.calc.mix_isotopes(proportions, *isotope_data)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • proportions (list) – A list of the proportion of each isotope abundance to be mixed.
  • isotope_data (numpy.ndarray) – A structured numpy array with each field corresponting to an isotope. Only those isotopes present in all given data arrays given will be used.
Returns:
Return type:

numpy.ndarray
isopy.calc.york_regression(X, Y, Xerr, Yerr, r=0, tol=1e-05)[source]¶
class isopy.calc.YorkRegression(slope, slope_error, intercept, intercept_error, sumW, xbar)[source]¶
y_error(x)[source]¶
isopy.calc.isobaric_interference_correction(data, ratio, abundance, mass=None, mf_factor=None, mf_law='exponential')[source]¶

Removed the isobaric contribution to all isotopes with the same mass as the specified ratios numerator.

Parameters:
  • data (numpy.ndarray) – Must
  • ratio (RatioString) – A ratio where the numerator is the isotope whose contribution to other isotopes of the same mass will be removed. The denominator is the isotope that will we used to calculate contribution of the numerator. Denominator must be present in data.
  • abundance (value, dict) – Can either be a value of the ratio specified or a dict of values where the ratio value can be found.
  • mass (value, dict) – Only required if mass fractionation correction is required. Can either be a value of the ratio specified or a dict of values where the ratio value can be found.
  • mf_factor (value) – If specified then the this value will be used to correct the mass fractionation. Will be applied to the abundance value of the ratio specified. This if used data should not have been internally normalised .
  • mf_law (str) – Mass fractionation law to be used. Defaults to the exponential law
